projects.title: Distributed E-Commerce Platform with Microservices
projects.description: Design and build a scalable e-commerce backend using microservices architecture with event-driven communication, distributed transactions, and high availability
projects.shortDescription: Microservices-based e-commerce platform with distributed architecture
projects.fullDescription: Architect and implement a production-grade e-commerce platform using microservices architecture. Build independent services for user management, product catalog, inventory, orders, and payments with event-driven communication using Kafka. Implement distributed transactions with saga pattern, API gateway, service discovery, and deploy on Kubernetes with monitoring and observability.

implementationSteps.title: Design System Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Design microservices architecture with 5 core services: User Service (authentication, profiles), Product Service (catalog management), Inventory Service (stock tracking), Order Service (order processing), Payment Service (payment handling). Define service boundaries using Domain-Driven Design principles. Create architecture diagrams showing service interactions, data flow, and communication patterns.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Event-Driven Communication
implementationSteps.description: Set up Apache Kafka as message broker for inter-service communication. Implement event sourcing pattern where each service publishes domain events (OrderCreated, PaymentProcessed, InventoryUpdated). Create event schemas and versioning strategy. Build event consumers in each service to react to relevant events and maintain eventual consistency.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Distributed Transactions with Saga Pattern
implementationSteps.description: Implement orchestration-based saga for order placement workflow: validate order → reserve inventory → process payment → confirm order. Handle compensating transactions for rollback (e.g., release inventory if payment fails). Use state machine to track saga execution. Implement timeout handling and retry mechanisms for failed steps.

implementationSteps.title: Build API Gateway & Service Discovery
implementationSteps.description: Set up API Gateway (Kong or custom Node.js/Go) for request routing, authentication, rate limiting, and response aggregation. Implement service discovery using Consul or Kubernetes DNS. Add circuit breakers using Hystrix or resilience4j to handle service failures gracefully. Implement distributed tracing with OpenTelemetry and Jaeger.

implementationSteps.title: Deploy on Kubernetes with Observability
implementationSteps.description: Create Kubernetes manifests (Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps, Secrets) for each microservice. Set up Helm charts for simplified deployment. Configure horizontal pod autoscaling based on CPU/memory. Implement monitoring with Prometheus and Grafana dashboards. Set up centralized logging with ELK stack (Elasticsearch, Logstash, Kibana). Add health checks and readiness probes.

projects.title: Real-Time Analytics Platform with Stream Processing
projects.description: Build a high-throughput real-time analytics platform using Kafka Streams, Redis caching, and TimescaleDB for processing millions of events per second
projects.shortDescription: Stream processing platform for real-time analytics at scale
projects.fullDescription: Design and implement a real-time analytics platform that ingests, processes, and visualizes streaming data at scale. Build data ingestion pipeline using Kafka, implement stream processing with Kafka Streams or Apache Flink, use Redis for real-time aggregations, store time-series data in TimescaleDB, and create a GraphQL API for querying analytics. Handle backpressure, implement exactly-once processing semantics, and optimize for low-latency queries.

implementationSteps.title: Design Data Pipeline Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Design end-to-end data flow: event producers → Kafka topics → stream processors → Redis/TimescaleDB → GraphQL API. Define event schemas for different event types (page views, clicks, purchases). Plan partitioning strategy for Kafka topics based on event keys. Design time-series data model in TimescaleDB with proper indexing and retention policies.

implementationSteps.title: Build Event Ingestion with Kafka
implementationSteps.description: Set up Kafka cluster (3 brokers for high availability). Create event producer service that accepts events via REST API and publishes to Kafka topics. Implement batching and compression for high throughput. Add schema validation using Avro or Protocol Buffers. Configure topic partitions and replication factor for fault tolerance.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Stream Processing
implementationSteps.description: Build Kafka Streams application for real-time aggregations: calculate counts, sums, and averages in tumbling/sliding windows. Implement stateful processing with RocksDB state stores. Handle late-arriving events and out-of-order data. Implement exactly-once semantics using Kafka transactions. Add custom aggregators for complex business metrics.

implementationSteps.title: Setup Caching and Time-Series Storage
implementationSteps.description: Configure Redis cluster for real-time metrics caching with TTL-based expiration. Use Redis Streams for recent event history. Set up TimescaleDB hypertables for historical analytics with automatic partitioning. Implement continuous aggregates (materialized views) for pre-computed metrics. Create retention policies to manage storage costs.

implementationSteps.title: Build GraphQL API and Monitoring
implementationSteps.description: Create GraphQL schema for querying real-time and historical analytics. Implement DataLoader pattern for batching database queries. Add subscriptions for real-time dashboard updates using WebSockets. Set up monitoring with Prometheus: track event throughput, processing lag, error rates. Create Grafana dashboards for operational visibility. Implement alerting for pipeline failures.

projects.title: Multi-Tenant SaaS Platform with Automated Infrastructure
projects.description: Build a multi-tenant SaaS platform with automated infrastructure provisioning, tenant isolation, and comprehensive observability on AWS/GCP
projects.shortDescription: Enterprise SaaS platform with Infrastructure as Code and multi-tenancy
projects.fullDescription: Architect and implement a production-ready multi-tenant SaaS platform. Design tenant isolation strategy (database per tenant vs schema per tenant), implement automated infrastructure provisioning using Terraform, build tenant onboarding workflow, create centralized authentication with OAuth2/OIDC, implement usage-based billing integration, and set up comprehensive monitoring and alerting. Deploy on AWS/GCP with auto-scaling, disaster recovery, and security best practices.

implementationSteps.title: Design Multi-Tenant Architecture
implementationSteps.description: Choose tenant isolation model: evaluate database-per-tenant (maximum isolation, higher cost) vs schema-per-tenant (balanced) vs row-level security (shared tables with tenant_id). Design tenant data model: organizations, users, roles, permissions. Plan shared services (authentication, billing) vs tenant-specific services. Document security boundaries and data isolation guarantees.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Infrastructure as Code with Terraform
implementationSteps.description: Create Terraform modules for tenant infrastructure: VPC, subnets, RDS instances, S3 buckets, CloudFront distributions. Implement tenant provisioning workflow that automatically creates isolated infrastructure on signup. Use Terraform workspaces or separate state files per tenant. Set up automated backup and disaster recovery. Implement infrastructure cost tracking per tenant.

implementationSteps.title: Build Authentication & Authorization System
implementationSteps.description: Implement OAuth2/OIDC provider (Keycloak or AWS Cognito) for centralized authentication. Build multi-tenant user management: support multiple organizations per user. Implement RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) with custom permissions. Add SSO support for enterprise customers (SAML, OAuth). Implement session management with JWT tokens and refresh token rotation.

implementationSteps.title: Implement Usage Metering & Billing
implementationSteps.description: Build metering system to track tenant resource usage: API calls, storage, compute time. Integrate with Stripe or similar for subscription billing. Implement usage-based pricing tiers and overage handling. Create billing dashboard showing current usage and costs. Set up automated invoicing and payment processing. Add usage alerts and rate limiting per tenant.

implementationSteps.title: Setup Observability & Security
implementationSteps.description: Implement tenant-aware logging: all logs tagged with tenant_id for isolation. Set up distributed tracing with OpenTelemetry across all services. Create per-tenant monitoring dashboards in Grafana. Implement security: encryption at rest and in transit, secrets management (AWS Secrets Manager), vulnerability scanning. Set up compliance logging for SOC2/GDPR. Create disaster recovery runbooks and automated failover.
